title: Shattered Relics League

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Shattered Relics League was the third league in Old School RuneScape. Originally set to release on 3 November 2021, the launch was delayed to 19 January 2022, and the league ended on 16 March 2022. It was announced on 3 February 2022 in a Modcast Q&A that it would be extended by two weeks, originally ending on 2 March 2022. The theme was set around collection and adventure and it was the first league to expand upon the lore of the game mode, with the introduction of The Sage.

content:
This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
Shattered Relics League
Type Leagues
Open date 19 January 2022
End date 16 March 2022
Update blog Leagues III - Shattered Relics Launch

The Shattered Relics League was the third league in Old School RuneScape. Originally set to release on 3 November 2021, the launch was delayed to 19 January 2022, and the league ended on 16 March 2022. It was announced on 3 February 2022 in a Modcast Q&A that it would be extended by two weeks, originally ending on 2 March 2022. The theme was set around collection and adventure and it was the first league to expand upon the lore of the game mode, with the introduction of The Sage.

Contents

  • 1 Overview
  • 2 Restrictions
  • 3 Tiers
  • 4 Relics and fragments
    • 4.1 Set effects
  • 5 Boosted Drops
  • 6 Tasks
  • 7 Rewards
    • 7.1 Leagues Trophy
    • 7.2 Shattered Relic Hunter outfit
    • 7.3 Shattered Relics Home Teleport Animation
    • 7.4 League Banner
    • 7.5 Weapon Variety Pack
    • 7.6 Dwarven Multicannon Ornament Kit
    • 7.7 Void & Elite Void Ornament Kit
    • 7.8 Mystic Ornament Kit
    • 7.9 Rewards Gallery
  • 8 Opening cinematic
    • 8.1 Credits
  • 9 Trivia
  • 10 References

Overview[edit | edit source]

The area where players arrive upon logging into a Shattered Relics League world.

In this iteration of Leagues, players have access to the entirety of the world map, rather than the area-restricted Twisted and Trailblazer Leagues. However, players do not have full access to their skills and various bosses; they must be unlocked through the use of Sage's Renown, a type of currency earned by completing specific tasks within the Shattered Relics League. In addition to Sage's Renown, completing these tasks also earns league points that can be used to purchase cosmetic rewards from the Leagues Reward Shop upon the end of the Shattered Relics League.

Relics, which are unlocks with powerful effects in past Leagues, are shattered into less-powerful fragments for this League. These fragments are collected by engaging in various activities within the League, such as skilling, minigames, and combat. While players initially can only equip one fragment, they can unlock the ability to equip more as additional tasks are completed.

Each fragment slot unlocked also brings additional passive bonuses that are always applied, such as experience and drop rate multipliers. Lastly, equipping enough fragments belonging to one category can grant set effects.

Restrictions[edit | edit source]

Main article: Shattered Relics League/Unlocks

Unlike the first two leagues, there are no area restrictions in the Shattered Relics League. Instead, players begin the league with most Skills and Bosses locked, which can be unlocked with Sage's Renown. Players begin the league on the outskirts of Catherby, by The Sage. The free Home Teleport spell in each spellbook is also redirected to Catherby. Waystones are placed in key locations that allow players to quickly teleport around the world for free after unlocking them.[1]

During the league, a multiplier was active for all experience gained, run energy never depleted, and clue scrolls were dropped as scroll boxes instead.[2]

As with all leagues, all accounts are automatically set to standard Ironman Mode.

The Leagues Unlocks interface created for Shattered Relics League.

Tiers[edit | edit source]

As the player progresses through the league, you'll gain different passive effects as you level up through tiers. Items affected by the boosted drop rates can be found here.

Tier Points Required Unlocks
1 0
  • First fragment slot
  • x5 League experience multiplier
  • A free combat fragment
2 10
  • Second fragment slot
  • Run energy will never drain whilst running
  • All un-started clues now stack as scroll boxes
  • Smooth Criminal fragment
3 300
  • Third fragment slot
  • x8 League experience multiplier
  • Doubled Kourend favour
  • A random tier 1 combat fragment
4 1,500
  • Fourth fragment slot
  • Items from some sources will be x2 as common
  • A random skilling fragment
5 3,000
  • Fifth fragment slot
  • x12 League experience multiplier
  • A random tier 2 combat fragment
6 7,500
  • Sixth fragment slot
  • Items from some sources will be x3 as common
  • Ability to choose slayer task. The same task can be chosen repeatedly
  • A random skilling fragment
7 15,000
  • Seventh fragment slot
  • x16 League experience multiplier
  • A random tier 3 combat fragment

Relics and fragments[edit | edit source]

Main article: Shattered Relics League/Fragments
An example of a Shattered Relics League fragment revealed during the Old School's Summer Summit.

Relics have been shattered into fragments and scattered all across Gielinor by The Sage who is concerned about the power that players hold. Individually, fragments contain a small portion of a relic's power, but they can be combined to create powerful effects. Fragments can be obtained by various activities through the world through RNG means. The number of fragments equipped is limited by the number of fragment slots unlocked, up to a maximum of seven. Fragments can also be leveled up to level 3 by gaining experience while they are equipped.

Upon unlocking your first combat skill, you get a specific fragment for Melee, Magic or Ranged, along with a few starter items for the relevant combat style.

Set effects[edit | edit source]

Main article: Shattered Relics League/Set Effects

Set effects become active once the player has equipped enough fragments from the same set. Each set effect requires a varying amount of fragments, and there may be multiple tiers within each set.

Boosted Drops[edit | edit source]

Main article: Shattered Relics League/Boosted Drops

As fragment slots are unlocked, passive bonuses will activate. Specific items will received boosted drop rates. Rates begin at 1x, increase to 2x when four fragment slots are unlocked, and 3x when six slots are unlocked.

Tasks[edit | edit source]

Main article: Shattered Relics League/Tasks

Tasks in the Shattered Relics League allows players to earn league points and Sage's Renown, which allow the player to unlock more Fragment slots, skills, bosses and auto-unlock quests. Tasks span five different difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, Hard, Elite and Master. In the league, there are hundreds of tasks to complete, ranging from reaching a certain level in a skill to killing certain bosses. As with the previous league, tasks are also divided into regions[3] despite the entire world being accessible, except for boss instances and also categorised by skill.

With every task completed, league points and Sage's Renown will be rewarded based on the difficulty of the task.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

See also: Leagues Reward Shop

After the league has concluded, players may spend league points to unlock rewards permanently. All the proposed rewards were polled and passed from October 7th-13th 2021.[4] Returning rewards from past leagues include League trophies, a Home Teleport animation, league themed outfits, and a league banner. New rewards include a Weapon Variety Pack, a Dwarven Multicannon Ornament Kit, and a Void Knight Ornament Kit.

Leagues Trophy[edit | edit source]

Main article: League trophy

League trophies range from bronze to dragon and are automatically rewarded to players based on their placement on the league HiScores. The trophies can be equipped and a unique emote can be accessed by right clicking on them. The trophies can also be displayed in a trophy case in a player-owned house.

Top percent Reward Required points
1% Shattered relics dragon trophy 52,545 Pts
5% Shattered relics rune trophy 31,980 Pts
20% Shattered relics adamant trophy 15,575 Pts
40% Shattered relics mithril trophy 5,475 Pts
60% Shattered relics steel trophy 1,660 Pts
80% Shattered relics iron trophy 480 Pts
100% Shattered relics bronze trophy 100 Pts

Shattered Relic Hunter outfit[edit | edit source]

The Shattered Relic Hunter outfits are potential rewards costing 1,000 (tier 1), 3,000 (tier 2), and 15,000 (tier 3) league points. There are three tiers of the Shattered Relic Hunter outfit, each costing more points than the previous. It is not necessary to buy the lower tiers of outfits to unlock or use the higher tier outfits.

Shattered Relics Home Teleport Animation[edit | edit source]

A home teleport animation is a potential reward costing 1,000 league points. The new animation shows the character placing down relics before dragged into the ground by multiple hands.

This reward replaces the default animation for the Home Teleport spells.

League Banner[edit | edit source]

The Shattered Themed Banner is a potential reward costing 500 league points. It can be worn in the main-hand slot, or displayed on the banner stand space in the League Hall of a player-owned house.

Weapon Variety Pack[edit | edit source]

The weapon variety pack is a potential reward costing 1,500 league points that can be used on the following items: Abyssal whip, tentacle whip, rune crossbow, and god books. Each weapon kit may only be used on one item at a time.

Dwarven Multicannon Ornament Kit[edit | edit source]

The ornament kit for the dwarven multicannon costs 4,500 league points. It is the first of its kind, and offers a cosmetic override to a classic item. The ornament kit replaces the single rotating barrel with eight barrels fixed in place. This design is based on the original RuneScape Classic multicannon. It comes with 4 uses to be applied to the four individual cannons parts.

Void & Elite Void Ornament Kit[edit | edit source]

The Shattered relics void ornament kit is a potential reward costing 6,500 league points. It has 6 pieces that can be applied to the normal and elite versions of all three combat types.

Mystic Ornament Kit[edit | edit source]

The Shattered relics mystic ornament kit is a potential reward costing 1,000 league points. It has 5 pieces that can be applied to all variants of Mystic robes.

Rewards Gallery[edit | edit source]

Opening cinematic[edit | edit source]

Upon logging in Shattered Relics League for the first time, players will watch an opening cinematic, which resembles a storybook of sorts with each frame representing a page and a bit of text.

  • Another chapter concluded... Thankfully we are safe here on this river. Don't worry, the next chapter is being written as we speak.

  • That's why I saved you, my friend. Why I spared you from being destroyed like all the others...

  • In return for your continued survivial, I need something from you... I need your skills, your strength. I need you to be... entertaining.

  • Do as I ask and I might be able to save you from destruction again, Fail me... and well... This chapter is where your story will end.

  • Oh yes! You brought along the relics. They were fun last time but... They find them boring now.

  • Let's see if I can shuffle the pieces, create something new! The eyes beyond our own need new stories!

  • Here we are. The shore lies just ahead. It's time to wake up... hero. Our voyage is coming to an end, but your journey is just beginning...

  • The track that plays during the opening cinematic for Shattered Relics League.

Credits[edit | edit source]

  • Implementation: Mod Brow, Mod Dylan
  • Art: Mod Jerv (illustrations), Mod West (animations)

Trivia[edit | edit source]

Bug:
Freeing King Awowogei in the Recipe for Disaster sub-quest may sometimes glitch, resulting in Gypsy Aris telling the player to ask King Awowogei about his favourite food before serving a stuffed snake to Awowogei in the dining hall, even if Awowogei at Marim tells the player they're not interested in talking and the three monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple acknowledge the stuffed snake in the player's inventory to be ready to serve. If the player serves the stuffed snake successfully and receives the sub-quest experience reward with a green quest completion in the Quest List, the Leagues unlocks interface may still indicate freeing Awowogei is incomplete and cost Sage's Renown. (This issue may have been patched on 26 January 2022.)
Bug:
The League task Complete the Prifddinas Agility Course in 1:10 stops tracking time and may be completed without time limitations if the player logs out during the Prifddinas Agility Course.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Old School RuneScape. "What is Leagues III: Shattered Relics? | Old School RuneScape." (112s), Youtube video. 8 January 2022.
  2. ^ Old School RuneScape. "What is Leagues III: Shattered Relics? | Old School RuneScape." (1:40), Youtube video. 8 January 2022.
  3. ^ Old School RuneScape. "Sneaking Into Leagues III: Shattered Relics (feat. J1mmy) | Old School RuneScape." (4m24s), YouTube video. 12 Jan 2022.
  4. ^ Jagex. [1] 7 October 2021. Old School RuneScape Polls.

The '''Shattered Relics League''' was the third [[Old School RuneScape Leagues|league]] in ''Old School RuneScape''. Originally set to release on [[3 November]] [[2021]], the launch was delayed to [[19 January]] [[2022]], and the league ended on [[16 March]] [[2022]]. It was announced on [[3 February]] [[2022]] in a Modcast Q&A that it would be extended by two weeks, originally ending on [[2 March]] [[2022]]. The theme was set around collection and adventure and it was the first league to expand upon the lore of the game mode, with the introduction of [[The Sage]].

==Overview==
[[File:Leagues III - Shattered Relics.png|thumb|300px|The area where players arrive upon logging into a Shattered Relics League world.]]
In this iteration of [[Leagues]], players have access to the entirety of the [[world map]], rather than the area-restricted [[Twisted League|Twisted]] and [[Trailblazer League]]s. However, players do not have full access to their [[skills]] and various [[boss]]es; they must be unlocked through the use of [[Sage's Renown]], a type of currency earned by completing specific tasks within the Shattered Relics League. In addition to Sage's Renown, completing these tasks also earns league points that can be used to purchase cosmetic rewards from the [[Leagues Reward Shop]] upon the end of the Shattered Relics League.

Relics, which are unlocks with powerful effects in past Leagues, are shattered into less-powerful [[Shattered Relics League/Fragments|fragments]] for this League. These fragments are collected by engaging in various activities within the League, such as skilling, minigames, and combat. While players initially can only equip one fragment, they can unlock the ability to equip more as additional tasks are completed.

Each fragment slot unlocked also brings additional passive bonuses that are always applied, such as experience and [[drop rate]] multipliers. Lastly, equipping enough fragments belonging to one category can grant [[Shattered Relics League/Set Effects|set effects]].

==Restrictions==
{{Main|Shattered Relics League/Unlocks}}
Unlike the first two leagues, there are no area restrictions in the Shattered Relics League. Instead, players begin the league with most [[Skills]] and [[Bosses]] locked, which can be unlocked with [[Sage's Renown]]. Players begin the league on the outskirts of [[Catherby]], by The Sage. The free [[Home Teleport]] spell in each [[Spellbook#Types_of_spellbooks|spellbook]] is also redirected to Catherby. [[Waystone|Waystones]] are placed in key locations that allow players to quickly teleport around the world for free after unlocking them.{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=What is Leagues III: Shattered Relics? {{!}} Old School RuneScape|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pwfn1ZlBq9o&t=112s|timestamp=112s|date=8 January 2022|site=Youtube}}

During the league, a multiplier was active for all [[experience]] gained, [[run energy]] never depleted, and [[clue scroll]]s were dropped as [[scroll box]]es instead.{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=What is Leagues III: Shattered Relics? {{!}} Old School RuneScape|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pwfn1ZlBq9o|timestamp=1:40|date=8 January 2022|site=Youtube}}

As with all leagues, all accounts are automatically set to standard [[Ironman Mode]].

[[File:Leagues 3 Unlocks Interface.png|thumb|The Leagues Unlocks interface created for Shattered Relics League.]]

==Tiers==
As the player progresses through the league, you'll gain different passive effects as you level up through tiers. Items affected by the boosted drop rates can be found [[Shattered Relics League/Boosted Drops|here]].

==Relics and fragments==
{{Main|Shattered Relics League/Fragments}}
[[File:Shattered Relics example fragment.png|thumb|An example of a Shattered Relics League fragment revealed during the Old School's Summer Summit.|alt=Base effect: reduce poison by 30%. Set effects: warrior, abyssal accumulator.]]
Relics have been shattered into fragments and scattered all across [[Gielinor]] by [[The Sage]] who is concerned about the power that players hold. Individually, fragments contain a small portion of a relic's power, but they can be combined to create powerful effects. Fragments can be obtained by various activities through the world through [[RNG]] means. The number of fragments equipped is limited by the number of fragment slots unlocked, up to a maximum of seven. Fragments can also be leveled up to level 3 by gaining experience while they are equipped.

Upon unlocking your first combat skill, you get a specific fragment for [[Melee]], [[Magic]] or [[Ranged]], along with a few starter items for the relevant combat style.
===Set effects===
{{Main|Shattered Relics League/Set Effects}}
Set effects become active once the player has equipped enough fragments from the same set. Each set effect requires a varying amount of fragments, and there may be multiple tiers within each set.

==Boosted Drops==
{{Main|Shattered Relics League/Boosted Drops}}
As fragment slots are unlocked, passive bonuses will activate. Specific items will received boosted drop rates. Rates begin at 1x, increase to 2x when four fragment slots are unlocked, and 3x when six slots are unlocked.

==Tasks==
{{Main|Shattered Relics League/Tasks}}

Tasks in the Shattered Relics League allows players to earn [[league points]] and [[Sage's Renown]], which allow the player to unlock more [[Shattered Relics League/Fragments|Fragment]] slots, [[skills]], [[bosses]] and auto-unlock [[quests]]. Tasks span five different difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, Hard, Elite and Master. In the league, there are hundreds of tasks to complete, ranging from reaching a certain level in a skill to killing certain bosses. As with the [[Trailblazer League|previous league]], tasks are also divided into regions{{CiteVideo|author=Old School RuneScape|title=Sneaking Into Leagues III: Shattered Relics (feat. J1mmy) {{!}} Old School RuneScape
|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eYFu1aFUqwk|timestamp=4m24s|date=12 Jan 2022|site=YouTube|lost=no}} despite the entire world being accessible, except for boss instances and also categorised by [[skills|skill]].

With every task completed, league points and Sage's Renown will be rewarded based on the difficulty of the task.

==Rewards==
{{see also|Leagues Reward Shop}}
After the league has concluded, players may spend league points to unlock rewards permanently. All the proposed rewards were polled and passed from October 7th-13th 2021.{{CitePoll|url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=poll/oldschool/results?id=1627|title=Leagues III - Shattered Relics Rewards Poll Blog|polldate=7 October 2021|notes=|name=}} Returning rewards from past leagues include [[League trophy|League trophies]], a Home Teleport animation, league themed outfits, and a league banner. New rewards include a Weapon Variety Pack, a [[Dwarf multicannon|Dwarven Multicannon]] Ornament Kit, and a [[Void Knight equipment|Void Knight]] Ornament Kit.

===Leagues Trophy===
{{main|League trophy}}
League trophies range from bronze to dragon and are automatically rewarded to players based on their placement on the league [[HiScores]]. The trophies can be equipped and a unique emote can be accessed by right clicking on them. The trophies can also be displayed in a [[trophy case space|trophy case]] in a [[player-owned house]].

===Shattered Relic Hunter outfit===
The Shattered Relic Hunter outfits are potential rewards costing 1,000 ([[Shattered Relic Hunter (T1)|tier 1]]), 3,000 ([[Shattered Relic Hunter (T2)|tier 2]]), and 15,000 ([[Shattered Relic Hunter (T3)|tier 3]]) league points. There are three tiers of the Shattered Relic Hunter outfit, each costing more points than the previous. It is not necessary to buy the lower tiers of outfits to unlock or use the higher tier outfits.

===Shattered Relics Home Teleport Animation===
A [[Shattered teleport scroll|home teleport animation]] is a potential reward costing 1,000 league points. The new animation shows the character placing down relics before dragged into the ground by multiple hands.

This reward replaces the default animation for the [[Home Teleport]] spells. 

===League Banner===
The [[Shattered banner|Shattered Themed Banner]] is a potential reward costing 500 league points. It can be worn in the main-hand slot, or displayed on the [[banner stand space]] in the [[League Hall]] of a player-owned house.

===Weapon Variety Pack===
The weapon variety pack is a potential reward costing 1,500 league points that can be used on the following items: [[Abyssal whip]], [[tentacle whip]], [[rune crossbow]], and [[god books]]. Each weapon kit may only be used on one item at a time.

===Dwarven Multicannon Ornament Kit===
The [[Shattered cannon ornament kit|ornament kit]] for the [[dwarven multicannon]] costs 4,500 league points. It is the first of its kind, and offers a cosmetic override to a classic item. The ornament kit replaces the single rotating barrel with eight barrels fixed in place. This design is based on the original ''[[RuneScape Classic]]'' {{RSCL|Dwarf multicannon|multicannon}}. It comes with 4 uses to be applied to the four individual cannons parts.

===Void & Elite Void Ornament Kit===
The [[Shattered relics void ornament kit]] is a potential reward costing 6,500 league points. It has 6 pieces that can be applied to the normal and elite versions of all three combat types.

===Mystic Ornament Kit===
The [[Shattered relics mystic ornament kit]] is a potential reward costing 1,000 league points. It has 5 pieces that can be applied to all variants of [[Mystic robes]].

===Rewards Gallery===
<gallery>

==Opening cinematic==
Upon logging in Shattered Relics League for the first time, players will watch an opening cinematic, which resembles a storybook of sorts with each frame representing a page and a bit of text.

<gallery mode="packed" heights="180" style="text-align:left">
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 1.png|''Another chapter concluded... Thankfully we are safe here on this river. Don't worry, the next chapter is being written as we speak.''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 2.png|''That's why I saved you, my friend. Why I spared you from being destroyed like all the others...''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 3.png|''In return for your continued survivial, I need something from you... I need your skills, your strength. I need you to be... entertaining.''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 4.png|''Do as I ask and I might be able to save you from destruction again, Fail me... and well... This chapter is where your story will end.''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 5.png|''Oh yes! You brought along the relics. They were fun last time but... They find them boring now.''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 6.png|''Let's see if I can shuffle the pieces, create something new! The eyes beyond our own need new stories!''
Shattered Relics League - opening cinematic, page 7.png|''Here we are. The shore lies just ahead. It's time to wake up... hero. Our voyage is coming to an end, but your journey is just beginning...''
Shattered Relics.ogg|The track that plays during the opening cinematic for Shattered Relics League.
</gallery>

==Trivia==
{{Bug|[[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing King Awowogei|Freeing King Awowogei]] in the [[Recipe for Disaster]] sub-quest may sometimes glitch, resulting in [[Gypsy Aris]] telling the player to ask [[King Awowogei]] about his favourite food before serving a [[stuffed snake]] to Awowogei in the dining hall, even if Awowogei at [[Marim]] tells the player they're not interested in talking and the three monkeys in the north-west corner of the temple acknowledge the stuffed snake in the player's inventory to be ready to serve. If the player serves the stuffed snake successfully and receives the sub-quest experience reward with a green quest completion in the [[Quest List]], the Leagues unlocks interface may still indicate freeing Awowogei is incomplete and cost Sage's Renown. (This issue may have been patched on [[26 January]] [[2022]].)}}<!--Yes, I had talked to the three monkeys (clicked one) before making the stuffed snake.-->
{{Bug|The League task <q>Complete the Prifddinas Agility Course in 1:10</q> stops tracking time and may be completed without time limitations if the player logs out during the [[Prifddinas Agility Course]].}}
